result.execSummary:
The defendant Jack G Trebtoske was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Theft-Movable Property <=$2500, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.20(1)(a).
  • Criminal Damage to Property, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.01(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Jail credit of 11 days, only if revoked.

miscConds.notes: to be paid within the first 6 months of probation.

The defendant must maintain/obtain full time employment/school that consists of at least 35 hrs/week.

When not full time employed/school, the defendant must apply for at least 3 jobs per week and report progress monthly to P&P with pertinent information in regards to applications.  The defendant must only apply for jobs qualified for - must accept any job offered - must not engage in any conduct that could result in the termination of his/her employment/school.

No consumption or possession of alcohol.
Not to enter any bars or taverns.

Must undergo Anger Management and follow through with any recommendations.

Take all medications as prescribed by a treating physician and only in the manner in which they are prescribed.
The defendant must undergo an AODA assessment and follow thru with all recommendations.

timeConds.notes: Perform 10 hours of community service per week when not full time employed or in school full time.

supervisions.notes:

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Jack G Trebtoske

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: 60 days jail as a condition of probation

records.descr: Notice of court ordered financial obligations

records.addlTxt: Defendant Jack G Trebtoske in court with attorney Timothy Drewa.  Charles James Simono appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Called at 1:51 PM. State - have complied with victim notification requirements and one victim is in the courtroom, has not received a VIS or request for restitution- resolved - joint recommendation of G/NC to count #1 as alleged and #4 as alleged, #2 and #3 - DRI, withhold sentence and place on probation for 2 years with conditions of: court costs, AODA and follow thru, anger management and follow thru, absolute sobriety, no possession or consumption of alcohol and no entry into any bars, taverns or similar establishments, employment/school, 10 hours of community service per week until full time employed or in school full time, take all medications as prescribed by a treating physician. Drewa and Trebtoske agree. Trebtoske pleads NC to counts #1 and #4 as alleged. Court dismisses and reads in counts #2 and #3. Court has plea questionnaire, goes thru it, finds the defendant has freely, voluntarily and intelligently waived his constitutional rights by entering his plea and right to JT, accepts plea, adjudges guilty, proceed to sentencing. State makes final argument prior to sentencing - follow joint recommendations - no objections to expunction upon successful completion of probation. Victim does not wish to make a statement. Drewa makes final argument prior to sentencing - follow joint recommendation.  Trebtoske makes statement, remorseful. Court sentences the defendant to the following: counts #1 and #4 - withhold sentence and place on probation for 2 years, concurrent to each other with conditions of: costs on each count - to be paid within the first 6 months of probation, AODA and follow thru, anger management and follow thru, no possession or consumption of alcohol and no entry into any bars or taverns, maintain/obtain full time employment/school, perform 10 hours of community service per week when not full time employed or in school full time, take all medications as prescribed by a treating physician and only in the manner in which they are prescribed, credit for 11 days only if revoked, addressed letter from P&P agent, taken care of thru sentencing so is not an issue any longer, right to appeal. Called 15TR150 - defendant pleads G, finds G, fine as indicated on the citation - combine with other payment plan on 14CM97/SL.
Must attend school everyday and not to be late or miss any classes, must do all assignments, no contact with victims and no consumption of alcohol.

Defendant Jack G Trebtoske in custody appears via video from FOSO - with attorney Timothy Drewa appearing in court.  Charles James Simono appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Called 11:12 a.m. Drewa has reviewed complaint and waives further reading, enters NG pleas on all counts. Court accepts plea. Drewa - requests signature bond for stated reasons. State - requests some cash for stated reasons. Court - $1000 signature bond, must attend school everyday and not to be late or miss any classes, must do all assignments, no contact with victims and no consumption of alcohol.  Final pre-trial scheduled for May 6, 2015 at 01:45 pm.

ADDRESS INFO for Jack G Trebtoske
Current: 7913 Hwy. 139, Argonne, WI 54511 United States  (Effective: 04-01-2015)
Prior: 6893 Old Hwy. 8 Road, Laona, WI 54541

Charles James Simono appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant Jack G Trebtoske in court, in custody and appears via video from FOSO. Defendant. Attorney Tim Drewa appears specially today for SPD as the defendant is eligible for SPD. Trebtoske does not have complaint. Court reads charges and penalties. Court sets for AIA, continues bond. Trebtoske makes statement, asks for signature bond for stated reasons. State - bond - objects at this point until hear more from SPD. Court continues bond at this point, can address bond again once an attorney is appointed. Trebtoske makes another statement regarding school work while incarcerated. Court responds.  Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for April 1, 2015 at 10:15 am.
